title: Rylan stops Strictly 'fight' breaking out between celeb guests in awkward clash
text:

Rylan Clark-Neal was forced to step in to stop a 'fight' breaking out on tonight's Strictly - It Takes Two.

The popular presenter, who was alongside stand-in host Gethin Jones, had to intervene when the celebrity guests started squabbling.

While dissecting the celebrities' rehearsal videos, comedian Rufus Hound laid into much-loved professional dancer Anton Du Beke.

While watching former footballer Alex Jones in training, Rufus said: "But we see it every year with the sports people on Strictly. They’re not performers in that way.

"Athletically they’ve got the ability, but actually dancing, as we know from Anton Du Beke, is 90% from the neck up."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Love Island winner Amber Gill burst out laughing, while TV presenter Gabby Roslyn looked mortified.

"Don’t diss Anton in the slightest," warned stunned Gabby while wagging her finger. She added: "Nothing negative."

Continuing to dig a deeper hole, Rufus said: "I love Anton but if you watch him dance you realise you’re not looking really from there down."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

The audience continued giggling while outraged Gabby started jokingly slapping Rufus' outstretched hand.

After putting his hand over his mouth in shock, Rylan said: "I can sense a fight breaking out. I’m going to have to move on because I can’t hear a bad word said about our Anton."

Gabby then stopped Rufus from blurting out any more insults by putting her hand over his mouth.

Doing a mocking digging motion, Rylan added: "Rufus, I’m going to help you out here and get out of that hole."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

It Takes Two viewers took to Twitter to praise Rufus for his frank comments on the panel.

One fan said: "Rufus Hound is amazingly good value on the Friday panel on #ItTakesTwo."

"Rufus Hound is always so spot on with his comments," added another.

A third said: "Rufus not afraid to tell it like it is. David James IS dull, doesn’t take the criticism well & frankly lacks personality!"

(Image: ITV)

However, others were annoyed at Rufus for speaking over the other celebrity superfans.

"Jesus why does Rufus Hound interrupt guests, go into rant mode and take over every show he's on, don't invite him onto," said one viewer.

Another added: "Yeah I’m a bit behind, but OMG, shut up, Rufus. They weren’t asking you!

"Shut up already, Rufus," said a third.

*Strictly - It Takes Two airs weeknights on BBC One at 5.15pm
description: The It Takes Two host had to step in after Rufus Hound and Gaby Roslin argued over his Anton Du Beke insult
